title: No New Mining Leases: Centre's Big Order On Aravallis
content: The government ordered a complete ban on new mining leases in the Aravallis today, amid the controversy over new rules announced recently on the definition of Aravalli hills and ranges.

title: No Tampering With Aravallis, "Breath" Of Rajasthan: Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma At NDTV Conclave
content: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma said today that the Aravalli mountains are the "breath" of the state, and the current government will not tolerate any interference with this natural heritage.

title: Video: Asked To Return Money, Man Blows Off Friend's Leg With A Rifle
content: A dispute over money ended in gunfire in Punjab's Batala area after a man allegedly shot his friend during an argument over a long-pending loan. The incident took place in Gokuwal village and was captured on a mobile phone camera.

title: Unnao Rape Survivor Visits Rahul Gandhi, Says "Want To Meet PM Too"
content: The survivor in the Unnao rape case and her mother met Congress's Rahul Gandhi this evening, hours after the elder woman was manhandled by the Central paramilitary personnel.

title: Delhi Breathes Easier After 13 Days As AQI Improves To 'Poor'
content: After nearly a fortnight of hazardous smog, Delhi's air quality improved to 'poor' at 271 on Wednesday on the back of stronger winds, though the conditions are forecast to worsen again.

title: Explained: Returned From Exile, What Is Zia Son's Gameplan For Bangladesh
content: As supporters of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) celebrate the return of Tarique Rahman to the country after 17 years, attention has shifted to the policies the party is likely to pursue under his leadership.

title: China Lists Arunachal As "Core Interest", Rules Out Compromise: US Report
content: A Pentagon report submitted to the US Congress has flagged China's claim over Arunachal Pradesh as part of its stated "core interests". The document states that China is not open to negotiation or compromise on these interests.

title: Explained: Why Assam's Karbi Anglong Autonomous District Erupted
content: There has been violence and tension in Assam's West Karbi Anglong for the last two days. Kheroni village has been particularly affected.

title: Russia Plans To Build Nuclear Plant On Moon By 2036, US Wants To Do It First
content: Russia plans to put a nuclear power plant on the moon in the next decade to supply its lunar space programme and a joint Russian-Chinese research station, as major powers rush to explore the earth's only natural satellite.

title: Strict Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-4 Lifted In Delhi As Air Quality Improves
content: Delhi has removed GRAP-4 conditions on controlling air pollution a week after imposing it due to the worsening situation

title: A Nitin Gadkari-Ismail Haniyeh Meet Hours Before Shocking Assassination
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has recounted a sequence of events that placed him in close proximity to one of the Middle East's most high-profile assassinations in recent years -- the killing of Hamas political chief Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.

title: Students Engage In Obscene Acts On Train, Driver Films Them. All 3 Charged
content: An FIR has been registered against three persons after an obscene video of two students inside the premium coach of a Namo Bharat train surfaced on social media, police said on Wednesday.

title: On Camera, Lord Vishnu Statue Destroyed In Cambodia, Allegedly By Thailand
content: As the conflict between Thailand and Cambodia drags on, a Cambodian official has accused Bangkok of destroying a statue of Lord Vishnu in a disputed border area.

title: Note Saying 'Trump Loves Young Girls' Is Fake: US Department Of Justice
content: The Department of Justice on Tuesday said that the handwritten letter by Jeffrey Epstein, addressed to convicted sex offender Larry Nassar, that was released as a part of the Epstein files, is "fake".

title: Video: Moment Cheap Ukrainian 'STING' Outsmarted A Russian Jet-Powered Shahed Drone
content: A video posted online captures the moment a small, fast-moving Ukrainian interceptor drone closes in on -- and destroys -- a Russian jet-powered Shahed suicide drone at altitude.

title: 15 Babies Sold For 15 Lakhs Each: Infant Selling Racket Busted In Telangana
content: The Cyberabad Special Operations Team in Telangana has dismantled a sophisticated interstate syndicate that was buying and selling infants across states for lakhs of rupees.

title: Adani Power Raises Long-Term Capacity Target To 41.87 Gigawatt By FY32
content: Adani Power Ltd has raised its long-term installed capacity target to 41.87 gigawatt by FY32 and committed capital expenditure of about Rs 2 lakh crore.

title: How 85-Year-Old Man Lost Rs 9 Crore In 'Digital Arrest' In Mumbai
content: A major cyber fraud has been reported from Mumbai, where an 85-year-old man from Mumbai's Thakurdwar area was cheated of nearly Rs 9 crore by fraudsters posing as police officers.

title: Gujarat Man Blocks Road To Burst Firecrackers, Says "I Am A Celebrity"
content: Vehicles helplessly waited and onlookers walked by with caution as a Surat businessman blocked a road to light fireworks to celebrate his son's birthday.

title: -30 Degrees, Low Oxygen Levels: How Army Survives In Himalayas During Winter
content: The weather in the remote snow-capped Himalayas has deteriorated significantly these days. Temperatures in Ladakh, Kargil, Galwan, North Sikkim, the Shamshabari Range, and the Greater Himalayan region have plummeted to several degrees below zero.

title: ITR filing: Got 'nudge' from I-T dept for claims? Here's what you need to do
content: ITR filing: ‚ÄãThe Income Tax Department has said that the Non-intrusive Usage of Data to Guide and Enable (NUDGE) campaign aims to encourage taxpayers to voluntarily review their deduction or exemption claims that have been identified as potentially ineligible through risk analytics by the department.

title: Big U-turn on Aravalli order: No new mining leases; protected zone to be expanded
content: The Centre has ordered a complete ban on new mining leases in the Aravallis and directed states to expand protected zones. This move aims to conserve the ancient mountain range, extending from Delhi to Gujarat, and halt unregulated mining. The government also intends to expand restricted areas based on ecological assessments.

title: Record! Karnataka script history; pull off unthinkable chase in VHT opener
content: Karnataka chased down a massive 413 to beat Jharkhand by five wickets in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Ishan Kishan‚Äôs blistering 125 had propelled Jharkhand to 412/9, but Devdutt Padikkal‚Äôs brilliant 147, supported by Mayank Agarwal, Abhinav Manohar, and Dhruv Prabhakar, guided Karnataka to victory with 15 balls to spare in a record-breaking chase.

title: ‚ÄòGo back to India‚Äô: Nick Fuentes unleashes anti-India, racist slurs against Ramaswamy
content: Far-right activist Nick Fuentes launched a racist tirade against Vivek Ramaswamy, telling the Indian-origin Republican to "go back to India." Fuentes attacked Ramaswamy's identity, marriage, and children, accusing him of not assimilating and questioning his American credentials. He also made antisemitic remarks, targeting both Indians and Jews.

title: AI investment race: Suleyman warns only giants can afford to lead
content: Mustafa Suleyman, head of Microsoft AI, emphasizes the staggering financial stakes in the AI landscape, estimating that companies may need to spend hundreds of billions to compete effectively. Such investment is necessary for building robust frameworks and securing premier talent, giving established powerhouses a formidable lead.

title: Merry Christmas 2025: Best wishes, messages, quotes, images & status
content: Christmas 2025 is presented as a feeling of warmth, joy, and togetherness, celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ. The article highlights the importance of digital communication for sharing wishes, messages, and quotes, emphasizing how these can uplift moods and strengthen bonds during the festive season.

title: Cambodia-Thailand clash: Lord Vishnu statue demolished - watch
content: Cambodia accused Thailand of destroying a Lord Vishnu statue in a disputed border area, amid renewed clashes that have killed over 40 and displaced nearly a million. Both sides blame each other for the violence, while diplomatic talks remain stalled.

title: Army deployed in Assam: Tensions high in Karbi Anglong; what triggered violence?
content: Army troops have been deployed to West Karbi Anglong to restore order. Violent protests have erupted over alleged illegal settlements by non-tribals. Two people have died and dozens are injured. Curfew-like restrictions and internet suspension are in place. The chief minister stated immediate eviction is not possible due to a court stay. Tensions over land rights escalated into clashes.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to deterministic automation in its Agentforce product. Executives acknowledge a decline in trust in AI models, with reported instances of models omitting instructions and losing focus. This strategic pivot follows significant support staff reductions attributed to AI agent deployment.

title: Capital chokes: GRAP-4 curbs lifted in Delhi; move comes hours after HC rap
content: Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) lifted GRAP-IV restrictions with immediate effect, even though air quality in several areas remained in the ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô category with AQI levels crossing 350. While the strictest curbs were withdrawn, Stage I, II and III measures will continue under the modified GRAP. The move came hours after the Delhi High Court pulled up the Centre

title: No more lottery: How new H-1B visa selection system will work ‚Äî key changes explained
content: After President Donald Trump proposed a $100,000 entry fee for new H-1B visa applications, the US Department of Homeland Security announced a major overhaul of the H-1B visa selection process. The department said that the long-standing random lottery system will be replaced with a wage-weighted model that prioritises higher-paid and higher-skilled applicants.

title: Musk waited in Netscape office lobby after applying; then started his own firm
content: Elon Musk, now the world's richest man, once struggled to land a job in the booming 90s internet sector. After a failed attempt to get hired at Netscape, where he even waited in the lobby, Musk decided to create his own software, a pivotal moment that led to his vast business empire. This early setback ultimately fueled his entrepreneurial journey.

title: VHT: Virat Kohli surpasses Sachin Tendulkar; saves Delhi with 131 knock
content: India's batting stalwart Virat Kohli starred with a brilliant 131 as Delhi chased down 299 to beat Andhra by four wickets in their Vijay Hazare Trophy opener in Bengaluru. Ricky Bhui‚Äôs 122 powered Andhra to 298/8, but strong support from Priyansh Arya and Nitish Rana helped Delhi seal victory in 37.4 overs.

title: Sophie Cunningham net worth 2025: WNBA salary, endorsements, and career rise
content: WNBA star Sophie Cunningham, known as the "enforcer" for the Indiana Fever, has garnered significant attention. She even surpassed Caitlin Clark in Google searches. Her career earnings, brand endorsements with Adidas and Arby's, and podcast deals contribute to her estimated $2 million net worth. Cunningham's athletic journey began with taekwondo before excelling in basketball, leading to numerous accolades.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce‚Äôs apology after Chiefs‚Äô playoff exit
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Taylor Swift opens up about cancer scare and Travis Kelce‚Äôs support
content: Taylor Swift opened up about a painful chapter during the Eras Tour, revealing how a backup singer‚Äôs cancer diagnosis deeply shook her tour family. The experience marked an emotional low point, but Swift said she later found renewed joy and stability in her personal life, crediting Travis Kelce with bringing light and happiness after an incredibly difficult period.

title: Shane McMahon and Marissa Mazzola‚Äôs combined net worth in 2025
content: Shane and Marissa Mazzola-McMahon possess a combined net worth of $650 million, largely attributed to Shane's decades with WWE and his diversified business ventures. While Shane's wealth stems from his executive roles, on-camera presence, and equity in WWE, Marissa's career in film production and PR augments their family fortune.

title: Online fraud by ‚Äòwealth managers‚Äô drove ex-Punjab IG to shoot self; chilling details pour out
content: Retired Punjab IG Amar Singh Chahal attempted suicide after losing Rs 8 crore in an online fraud. Scammers posing as wealth managers lured him with fake returns, leading him to invest heavily and borrow from friends and family. An FIR has been filed against unidentified persons.

title: BlueBird Block-2 mission: Isro shares unique view of Baahubali's liftoff ‚Äî watch
content: ISRO's LVM3-M6 rocket successfully launched the BlueBird Block-2 satellite for AST SpaceMobile, offering a unique onboard camera perspective of the entire mission. The footage captured liftoff, booster separation, and satellite deployment into Low Earth Orbit, marking a significant commercial success for ISRO's heavy-lift vehicle.

title: 'Arunachal now China's core interest': US flags Beijing's 'rejuvenation' plan; what is it
content: A Pentagon report reveals China's inclusion of Arunachal Pradesh among its core interests, alongside Taiwan and maritime disputes, as part of its national rejuvenation goals. The report also details deepening China-Pakistan military and strategic ties, including arms co-production and potential logistics facilities, while noting China's sensitivity to perceived threats to CCP legitimacy.

title: 'His bail like kaal for us': Unnao rape survivor to move SC; uproar over relief for Sengar
content: The Unnao rape survivor expressed deep distress over Kuldeep Singh Sengar's bail, calling it 'death' for her family and vowing to challenge the Delhi High Court's decision in the Supreme Court. The court suspended Sengar's life sentence, citing he shouldn't be jailed solely on victim threat perception, while imposing strict bail conditions.

title: Saif Ali Khan's stabbing, Virat Kohli's 'like': Bollywood controversies of 2025
content: 2025 saw significant Bollywood moments, from Saif Ali Khan's heroic act of protecting his son during a home invasion to Virat Kohli's clarification on an accidental social media like. Diljit Dosanjh's film 'Sardaarji 3' faced controversy over casting a Pakistani actress, while Deepika Padukone's exits from 'Spirit' and 'Kalki 2' sparked discussions about industry demands.

title: Tracked, shot 4 bullets: How Bengaluru techie gunned down his wife; here's what happened
content: A software professional allegedly shot his estranged wife dead on a busy Bengaluru road during rush hour following prolonged marital discord. The accused surrendered to the police with the pistol. The victim had sought legal separation, which the accused reportedly refused, leading to the fatal incident.

title: Magnesium and dementia risk: What happens to your brain when you take magnesium daily
content: New research suggests that increasing magnesium intake could significantly benefit brain health and potentially lower dementia risk. Studies indicate higher magnesium levels are linked to larger brain volume and fewer lesions, suggesting a younger-looking brain. Incorporating magnesium-rich foods like leafy greens, nuts, and seeds is recommended for optimal cognitive function as we age.

title: VHT: Fastest ever century! Rohit Sharma lights up Mumbai opener
content: India's batting stalwart Rohit Sharma smashed a brilliant 155 off 94 balls as Mumbai thrashed Sikkim by eight wickets in their Vijay Hazare Trophy opener in Jaipur. Sikkim posted 236/7, led by Ashish Thapa‚Äôs 79. Mumbai chased the target in just 30.3 overs, with Rohit dominating the contest. They will be confident going into the next matches.

title: Mumbai shocker: 85-year-old loses Rs 9cr in ‚Äòdigital arrest‚Äô; how police cracked case
content: Mumbai cyber police arrested a 27-year-old company director in connection with a Rs 9 crore digital arrest scam targeting an 85-year-old retired teacher. The accused's company account received a portion of the victim's funds, which was also linked to other senior citizen fraud cases totaling Rs 5.65 crore.

title: Masashi 'Jumbo' Ozaki: Legendary Japanese golf star dies at 78
content: Japanese golf legend Masashi ‚ÄúJumbo‚Äù Ozaki has died at 78 after a battle with sigmoid colon cancer. A national icon, Ozaki won 113 tournaments worldwide and inspired a generation of golfers, becoming the first Japanese player to finish in the Masters top 10. His unparalleled career achievements remain unmatched in Japan.

title: 'Lower tax on air purifiers': HC asks GST Council to hold meet; Delhi's toxic air in focus
content: The Delhi High Court has urged the GST Council to hold a meeting to consider reducing the 18% GST on air purifiers due to severe air pollution. The court was hearing a plea seeking to declare air purifiers as ‚Äúmedical devices‚Äù and exempt them from GST, the court said air purifiers could not be treated as luxury items in a city battling extreme air pollution.

title: Ashes: No Archer and Pope! England make changes to XI for 4th Test
content: England have made key changes for the Boxing Day Ashes Test against Australia. Jofra Archer is ruled out for the rest of the series with a side strain, replaced by Gus Atkinson. Ollie Pope has been dropped for Jacob Bethell. Despite being 3-0 down, England hope the changes spark a turnaround in Melbourne.

title: 5 reasons why your digestion gets worse in the winters
content: Winter's chill and shorter days quietly slow your digestion.  Cold temperatures, reduced activity, and richer foods make your gut work harder and slower.  Lower water intake and disrupted sleep further complicate things.  Understanding these seasonal shifts can help you support your digestive system through the colder months with simple adjustments.

title: Odisha shocker: Minor girl ‚Äòraped and murdered‚Äô; body found in jungle
content: A 10-year-old girl was found dead in a jungle in Bhadrak district. She had gone to school and did not return home. Family members found her body and filed a police complaint. Police are investigating the case as assault and murder. Angry locals blocked the highway demanding justice for the victim.

title: CAT 2025 result released at iimcat.ac.in: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The Indian Institute of Management has released the CAT 2025 result on iimcat.ac.in, ending weeks of anticipation for MBA aspirants. The scorecards display scaled scores and normalised percentiles across exam slots. These results will guide shortlisting for WAT, GD, and PI rounds conducted by IIMs and other management institutes. Candidates must check the direct link provided here to download the CAT result 2025.

title: Delhi Metro expansion: Cabinet clears Phase-VA - all you need to know
content: The Union Cabinet has greenlit Delhi Metro's Phase-VA, adding 13 new stations and over 16 km to the network, extending it beyond 400 km. This Rs 12,015 crore expansion aims to boost connectivity in Central Delhi and the airport area, reduce traffic, and cut pollution. The project is slated for completion within three years.

title: 'Two days in Delhi, I get infection‚Äô: Gadkari flags severity of air pollution; highlights fossil fuel use
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari highlighted Delhi's severe air pollution, attributing 40% to the transport sector's reliance on fossil fuels. He urged a shift to electric and hydrogen mobility, framing it as a nationalistic imperative to reduce costly imports and pollution. Gadkari emphasised India's potential for cleaner fuel alternatives and advancements in electric vehicle technology.

title: Vinod Kumar Shukla, first Jnanpith awardee from Chhattisgarh, dies at 88
content: Renowned Hindi writer Vinod Kumar Shukla passed away at 88 after a lung ailment. The first Jnanpith awardee from Chhattisgarh, Shukla was known for his quiet grace and focus on ordinary people's inner worlds. He continued writing even in the ICU, leaving behind a legacy of profound literature.

title: 'Kicked her in stomach': Man assaults pregnant woman while celebrating Jagan Reddy's birthday
content: A man in Sri Sathya Sai district was arrested and paraded for allegedly assaulting a six-month pregnant woman. The incident occurred when the woman objected to loud cracker bursting during a birthday celebration. Police have registered a case and emphasized strict action against crimes targeting women and children.

title: Vince & Linda McMahon net worth in 2025: WWE earnings, careers and investments
content: Wrestling titans Vince and Linda McMahon boast a $3.2 billion net worth in 2025, largely from their WWE empire and TKO Group Holdings shares. Vince's legacy in transforming wrestling is undeniable, while Linda also carved a significant business and political path. Despite recent legal challenges for Vince, their financial success endures.

title: Unnao rape survivor‚Äôs mother blocked from protest; claims daughter is 'held captive'
content: Security personnel in Delhi reportedly stopped an Unnao rape survivor and her mother from protesting at India Gate. The duo were demonstrating against the Delhi High Court's decision to grant relief to former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar. The victim's mother expressed distress, stating they were not granted justice and feared for their safety.

title: Venus Williams‚Äô love story: Who is her husband Andrea Preti and why the couple had two weddings
content: Tennis star Venus Williams and her husband Andrea Preti celebrated two weddings in 2025. After an initial ceremony in Italy in September, the couple exchanged vows again in a lavish five-day event in Palm Beach, Florida, in December.  The second wedding was necessitated by international registration delays and honored Venus's Florida heritage.

title: 'Won't bow down': Thackeray cousins reunite after 20yrs for BMC polls; present united front
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS have announced an alliance for upcoming BMC and other civic body elections, marking a political reunion of Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj. Seat-sharing agreements have been finalized, with the NCP (SP) also included in some discussions. This move is seen as a significant development in Maharashtra politics.

title: World record in Ranchi! Bihar smash highest-ever List A total; Sakibul Gani hits fastest 100
content: Bihar shattered List A cricket history, posting a world-record 574/6 against Arunachal Pradesh. Captain Sakibul Gani hit the fastest Indian List A century (32 balls), while 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed 190 off 84 balls, becoming the youngest List A centurion ever. Ayush Loharuka also contributed a century in the dominant batting display.

title: VHT: 16,000 and counting! Virat Kohli enters elite List A club with Sachin Tendulkar
content: Virat Kohli achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second Indian after Sachin Tendulkar to surpass 16,000 List A runs during the Vijay Hazare Trophy. His return to domestic cricket also serves as crucial preparation for India's upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

title: Sanctity of TTD compromised during YSRCP rule, alleges R&B Minister Janardhan Reddy
content: Stating that the coalition government is taking corrective steps, the Minister says industrial investments, recruitment drives and infrastructure projects are gaining pace

title: Prakasam police recover 342 stolen mobile phones worth ‚Çπ50 lakh in three months
content: Since November 2021, the district police traced over 6,447 mobile phones worth approximately ‚Çπ9.50 crore and handed them over to their owners

title: Protests continue in Dharwad, Haveri, Kalaburagi against honour killing
content: Members come out to strongly condemn the incident in which a pregnant woman was murdered by her father for marrying outside caste

title: KLU convocation to be held on December 27
content: Degrees will be awarded to 5,000 students who completed studies during the¬†2025 academic year, says university V-C

title: Congress protests in Bengal over renaming of MGNREGA; State Congress chief courts arrest
content: They condemned the Union government‚Äôs decision to remove Mahatma Gandhi‚Äôs name from the flagship 100-day work¬†scheme

title: Kerala to introduce nativity card to address citizenship concerns
content: Chief Minister says Cabinet has approved in-principle the issuance of a permanent nativity card with a photo in place of the nativity certificate currently being issued in the State

title: T.N. govt. sanctions ‚Çπ289.63-crore relief for crop damage
content: The relief is for crops damaged on 5.66 lakh acres due to rain during the northeast monsoon in November and December 2024, and in January 2025

title: Centuries-old duck-rearing practice at risk as avian flu hits Kuttanad again
content: The latest outbreak of bird flu, the seventh in the region in 11 years, has already resulted in the death of around 55,000 birds, with more set to be culled as part of preventive measures. A decade ago, 10-15 lakh ducks were reared in the region annually, which has fallen to around three lakh now and is likely to decline further, say farmers' forums

title: Nirmala Sitharaman to visit her adopted village in West Godavari on December 28
content: During her one-day visit to Pedda Mynavani Lanka, the Union Finance Minister will inspect the sea protection wall being built at a cost of ‚Çπ13.50 crore and inaugurate a drone and AI training programme for fisherfolk

title: Will ensure job for every Bihari in Bihar: Samrat Choudhary
content: The Deputy CM and BJP leader says the land of Bihar has been a land of knowledge and sacrifice, and now is the time to bring back that glorious history

title: Telangana DCA seeks 100 more drug inspectors as enforcement load outpaces manpower
content: At present, there are only 65 to 70 drug inspectors overseeing nearly 50,000 regulated units across the State

title: Collector inaugurates shop selling products made by persons with intellectual disabilities
content: The shop is located at 143, South Avenue, Phase 1, Sathuvachari, Vellore and will be open between 11 a.m and 7 p.m on all days except on Sundays

title: Polavaram Project Authority satisfied with progress of works
content: Team led by Chief Executive Officer Yogesh Paithankar inspects various components of the project, and insists on timely completion, without delays, strictly adhering to approved schedules and action plans

title: Indian farmers should learn to compete at global level, says Minister
content: They should adopt new technologies in cultivation, processing and marketing their produce, he says at Horticulture Mela in Bagalkot

title: Third-time councillor Saiji Jolly to be Aluva municipal chairperson
content: Saiji Jolly, deputy chairperson in the previous council headed by Congress veteran M.O. John, won from Nazreth ward, defeating BJP‚Äôs Sivapriya G. Kammath

title: CPO dismissed from service citing indiscipline
content: Dismissal was ordered by Pathanamthitta District Police Chief for repeatedly insulting the State police force and senior officers on social media and for committing acts of indiscipline

title: CPI(M) demands action against police for ‚Äòassault‚Äô on tribals in Eluru district
content: Police destroyed standing maize crops using tractors and assaulted protesting tribals, leaving several injured, allege party leaders

title: Govt. invites agri-business companies to partner with farmer groups under KERA project
content: The programme aims to create structured market linkages that connect Kerala‚Äôs premium agricultural produce to local, national and international markets, ensuring that farmers receive better prices and a secure market linkage

title: Govt. notifies wide-ranging amendments to  Revenue laws revenue reforms, title deed drive signal push for administrative clarity
content: It also accelerated the creation of revenue villages and the distribution of title deeds to long-settled residents living without ownership documents

title: Arrangements in place for hassle-free darshan to pilgrims for 10-day ‚ÄòVaikuntha Ekadasi‚Äô in Tirumala
content: Pilgrims selected through the e-dip will get darshan on the first three days commencing December 30, while it will be normal ‚Äòsarva darshan‚Äô for the remaining seven days; social media users warned against misleading the public with fake news or half-truths

title: Army deployed in Assam's violence-hit West Karbi Anglong
content: Two persons were killed, and 45 others, including 38 police personnel, injured as violence rocked West Karbi Anglong district

title: Youth must contribute to building a prosperous nation, says Governor
content: Thaawarchand Gehlot tells students that education is a continuous journey and a nation‚Äôs most valuable asset

title: Rahul Gandhi meets Unnao rape survivor, says 'we're turning into dead society'
content: The 2017 Unnao rape survivor said she would move the Supreme Court against the Delhi High Court's decision to suspend the jail term of expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar

title: Six-year-old Bharatanatyam prodigy to perform in Hubballi on Sunday
content: Kumari Poorna Pawar will perform at a dance recital, Prathama Pallava, being organised by Kala Sujaya, a centre for Indian classical arts

title: Navi Mumbai court convicts two Bangladeshi nationals for illegal stay in India
content: It also directed the Navi Mumbai police chief to take steps for their deportation to Bangladesh through the Bangladesh Embassy

title: Port workers‚Äô body seeks redress of fishermen grievances in Andhra Pradesh
content: In a representation to Union Minister for Ports Santanu Thakur, the AIPTWF raises concern over marine pollution caused by discharge of industrial waste into the sea and hardships faced by workers employed in port yard areas

title: Thackeray cousins want power, not development of Mumbai: Shinde
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) president Raj Thackeray earlier in the day announced the alliance of their parties ahead of the January 15 Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections

title: BJP stages protest against hate speech Bill
content: Party members term the Karnataka Hate Speech and Hate Crimes (Prevention) Bill 2025 as anti-Constitutional

title: Christmas is when Kolkatans abroad return home ‚Äî to sweets, savouries and the ambience
content: ‚ÄòKolkata in winter has a different charm altogether, the city touches the soul around this time,‚Äô a visiting academic said

title: Watch: Tamil Nadu SIR: Eight unusual patterns in the deleted electors list: Data Point
content: Over 97 lakh electors have been deleted from the voter lists in Tamil Nadu as part of the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls. In this video, we analyse data from over 75,000 polling stations across Tamil Nadu to identify eight distinct and unusual patterns that define this massive update.

title: Watch: Deadly tiger MDT-37‚Äôs capture exposes Nilgiris man‚Äìanimal conflict
content: When B. Nagi failed to return from grazing her goats in a Nilgiris village, fear spread fast. Forest teams traced the threat to MDT-37, an ageing, injured tiger pushed out of Mudumalai‚Äôs core. This story follows the search, the capture, and the fragile line between people and predators.

title: Tea stall owner in Bengaluru sets woman on fire for refusing to marry off daughter to him
content: Police said the accused had been pressuring Geetha to marry off her 19-year-old daughter to him. When the woman repeatedly refused, he allegedly resorted to threats and harassment.

title: Two Sri Lankan nationals held for attempting to board U.K.-bound flight using exchanged passports at Bengaluru airport
content: An investigation is under way to determine why the two Sri Lankan nationals attempted to board the flight using Malaysian passports

title: Karnataka government stands by Belagavi DC, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: Defending the decision to issue prohibitory orders against Maharashtra MP Dhairyasheel Mane, the Minister said that Belagavi Deputy Commissioner Mohammad Roshan wanted to avoid law and order problems during the Black Day observation by Maharashtra Ekikaran Samithi

title: 'Sanatan Dharma' not safe in West Bengal, alleges Suvendu
content: Suvendu Adhikari asked the police to mend their ways or face "consequences" after April, when the assembly elections would be due in the State

title: After IndiGo crisis, aviation ministry gives nod to two new Indian airlines
content: AI Hind Air aims to begin operations in southern India with a fleet of ATR Turboprop ‚Å†aircraft, while Fly Express website says "coming soon‚Äù

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Power Rankings: Kentucky, Seton Hall crack top 25
content: Kentucky dropped out of these Power Rankings back on Dec. 4 . the Wildcats lost by 35 points to Gonzaga in Nashville on tuesday . a complete roster looks very much like a top-25 team, if the second half is any indication .

title: Which of these eight midfield targets fits best at Man United?
content: the need for a new midfield partner in the center of Ruben Amorim's midfield is more pressing than ever . the midfielder's recent comments suggest that united may even have two midfield roles to fill soon . however, sources say at least seven midfielders were under consideration .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Sieh Bangura carries Ohio to seventh straight bowl win
content: Ohio RB Sieh Bangura rushed 23 yards for a touchdown to widen the Bobcats' lead . the 2025 bowl season is in full swing and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances . we'll pick MVPs from each game from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 .

title: 'Probably will be a Netflix documentary': Inside the twists and turns of Penn State's 58-day coaching search
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with each having six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: Wait, no Jordan Love? The biggest Pro Bowl snubs for the AFC and NFC rosters
content: there are always a few standout players who should make the Pro Bowl . the snubs aren't named to the initial AFC and NFC rosters . a handful of players may be disappointed to not make the AFC or NFC teams .

title: The budding Spurs-Thunder rivalry that could shape the future of the West
content: wemby believes he's the best overall player in the league . the defending champions had snapped their 16-game winning streak in the most high-stakes game of the season . wembanyama has had a frosty competitive relationship with 'chet Holmgren' .

title: Metcalf's ban upheld; fan's conduct under review
content: dK Metcalf will sit out the final two games of the regular season . he will forfeit $555,556 in salary . the suspension also voids $45 million in future guaranteed money . his contract was reviewed by CBS Sports and ESPN .

title: Nepal topples, B'desh boils & Pak teeters: How 2025 shook India's neighbours
content: india watched with concern as neighbourhood navigated troubled waters marked by protests, political instability and humanitarian emergencies . protests in Nepal shook the political regime, resulting in former PM KP Sharma Oli‚Äôs resignation . Bangladesh, already reeling under a political crisis since sheikh Hasina‚Äôs ouster, witnessed mass anti-India protests after the assassination of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi .
